form.onblur: Fires the moment that the element loses focus
form.onchange: Fires the moment when the value of the element is changed
form.oncontextmenu: Script to be run when a context menu is triggered
form.onfocus: Fires the moment when the element gets focus
form.oninput: Script to be run when an element gets user input
form.oninvalid: Script to be run when an element is invalid
form.onreset: Fires when the Reset button in a form is clicked
form.onsearch: Fires when the user writes something in a search field (for <input="search">)
form.onselect: Fires after some text has been selected in an element
form.onsubmit: Fires when a form is submitted

keyboard.onkeydown: Fires when a user is pressing a key
keyboard.onkeypress: Fires when a user presses a key
keyboard.onkeyup: Fires when a user releases a key

mouse.onclick: Fires on a mouse click on the element
mouse.ondblclick: Fires on a mouse double-click on the element
mouse.onmousedown: Fires when a mouse button is pressed down on an element
mouse.onmousemove: Fires when the mouse pointer is moving while it is over an element
mouse.onmouseout: Fires when the mouse pointer moves out of an element
mouse.onmouseover: Fires when the mouse pointer moves over an element
mouse.onmouseup: Fires when a mouse button is released over an element
mouse.onmousewheel: Deprecated. Use the onwheel attribute instead
mouse.onwheel: Fires when the mouse wheel rolls up or down over an element

drag.ondrag: The event occurs when an element is being dragged
drag.ondragend: The event occurs when the user has finished dragging an element
drag.ondragenter: The event occurs when the dragged element enters the drop target
drag.ondragleave: The event occurs when the dragged element leaves the drop target
drag.ondragover: The event occurs when the dragged element is over the drop target
drag.ondragstart: The event occurs when the user starts to drag an element
drag.ondrop: The event occurs when the dragged element is dropped on the drop target

clipboard.oncopy: Fires when the user copies the content of an element
clipboard.oncut: Fires when the user cuts the content of an element
clipboard.onpaste: Fires when the user pastes some content in an element

multimedia.onabort: Script to be run on abort
multimedia.oncanplay: Script to be run when a file is ready to start playing (when it has buffered enough to begin)
multimedia.oncanplaythrough: Script to be run when a file can be played all the way to the end without pausing for buffering
multimedia.oncuechange: Script to be run when the cue changes in a <track> element
multimedia.ondurationchange: Script to be run when the length of the media changes
multimedia.onemptied: Script to be run when something bad happens and the file is suddenly unavailable (like unexpectedly disconnects)
multimedia.onended: Script to be run when the media has reach the end (a useful event for messages like "thanks for listening")
multimedia.onerror: Script to be run when an error occurs when the file is being loaded
multimedia.onloadeddata: Script to be run when media data is loaded
multimedia.onloadedmetadata: Script to be run when meta data (like dimensions and duration) are loaded
multimedia.onloadstart: Script to be run just as the file begins to load before anything is actually loaded
multimedia.onpause: Script to be run when the media is paused either by the user or programmatically
multimedia.onplay: Script to be run when the media is ready to start playing
multimedia.onplaying: Script to be run when the media actually has started playing
multimedia.onprogress: Script to be run when the browser is in the process of getting the media data
multimedia.onratechange: Script to be run each time the playback rate changes (like when a user switches to a slow motion or fast forward mode)
multimedia.onseeked: Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to false indicating that seeking has ended
multimedia.onseeking: Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to true indicating that seeking is active
multimedia.onstalled: Script to be run when the browser is unable to fetch the media data for whatever reason
multimedia.onsuspend: Script to be run when fetching the media data is stopped before it is completely loaded for whatever reason
multimedia.ontimeupdate: Script to be run when the playing position has changed (like when the user fast forwards to a different point in the media)
multimedia.onvolumechange: Script to be run each time the volume is changed which (includes setting the volume to "mute")
multimedia.onwaiting: Script to be run when the media has paused but is expected to resume (like when the media pauses to buffer more data)

touch.ontouchcancel: The event occurs when the touch is interrupted
touch.ontouchend: The event occurs when a finger is removed from a touch screen
touch.ontouchmove: The event occurs when a finger is dragged across the screen
touch.ontouchstart: The event occurs when a finger is placed on a touch screen
